subject: Data
title: Base Rate Neglect: The Hidden Denominator
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Base Rate Neglect: The Hidden Denominator.

hook.text: A test is 99% accurate. You test positive. Most people assume 99% chance they're sick. They're usually wrong.

buildup.text: Base rate neglect means ignoring how common the condition is in the population before interpreting results.

discovery.text: If the disease affects 1 in 10,000, even a 99% accurate test gives mostly false positives.

twist.text: This error has real consequences: unnecessary treatments, unwarranted fear, and wasted resources.

climax.text: Always ask: how common is this to begin with? That one question changes every probability calculation.

punchline.text: Accuracy means nothing without the base rate.

quiz.question: What is base rate neglect?
options: Ignoring how common something is when interpreting probabilities
